commands.description: Gives you information about the bot. If you use '-dm', it sends to you in DMs.
Set the channel to the guild's counting channel. Leave empty to use the current channel. Note: Commands will be disabled in the counting channel.
Toggle modules. Leave empty to get a list of modules.
Subscribe to a count in the guild.
Set the topic. Leave empty to clear topic. Set to 'disable' to disable it completely. If you use {{COUNT}} as a placeholder, you can customize it to however you want.
Set the count to a specific count.

commands.args: <mode: each|only> <count> <duration: permanent:temporary> <role name, mention or ID>
commands.description: Set up a prize so people can get prizes when they count. Note: Give Countr the Manage Roles-permission and have the Countr-role over the role(s) you want to be rewarded.

modules.description: This allows members to count more than once in a row, without someone else typing between.
This allows members to talk after the count, ex. '1337 hello Admin!'
This makes the bot repost the message, preventing the user to edit or delete the count afterwards.
This makes the reposted message be a webhook. (Requires the 'reposting'-module)
